blog.name: thedemonphanti
blog.title: thedemonphanti
blog.description: Treat People With Respect | Unpopular Opinions Welcome

summary: Newsflash: Dan and Phil are partners, which means they make decisions together (even the ones you don’t like)
body:
Newsflash: Dan and Phil are partners, which means they make decisions together (even the ones you don’t like)

I posted something similar in a reblog, but have heard enough people saying that the DAPG hiatus was a unilateral decision made by Dan that I wanted to make a separate post to say that there is no evidence to support that theory. I might be more inclined to believe it if the timing coincided, but Dan stopped posting videos on DINOF over a half a year prior to the DAPG hiatus. I know the phandom has a tendency to paint Dan as the bad guy and Phil as an innocent bystander, but they are business partners and best friends and if they didn’t have an effective way of discussing things and making decisions together, neither of those relationships would have lasted for this long. Most of the evidence we have, especially the fact that they said as much at the first Interactive Introverts show, before taking it out because it upset people, points to the fact that Dan and Phil have been wanting to focus on their solo channels/projects for a while now. Even if Dan decided he no longer wanted to do YouTube, I highly doubt he would be so cavalier about something that would have such a big impact on Phil to just up and quit on a whim. The most likely scenario is that they had been planning this for quite some time and made these decisions together and the phandom should learn to accept that and not try to scapegoat one or the other.

julia | 16 | she/her | 🇬🇧+🇵🇱

~those two long beans own my entire heart~

tags: its not easter themed but i did it at easter so i think it counts
body:
Dan and Phil wouldn’t do any Easter baking so I took things into my own hands :)

A variety of different bakes (and non-bakes);

a caramel/chocolate cheesecake (of which I don’t have a finished product picture oops)

An Oreo tart,

and a carrot cake

And just like a Dan and Phil™ bake, they slightly look like shit👍🏼

blog.name: glitter-intheair
blog.title: way out of sync from the beginnin'
blog.description: alex [she/her] since 1990, italian, bi, infj, capricorn

summary: I just wish people would stop yelling at others how they should suck it up and enjoy being in the phandom even if there's no new...
question: I just wish people would stop yelling at others how they should suck it up and enjoy being in the phandom even if there's no new content. Don't get me wrong, I love the community but that can't be the only source of entertainment for me ://
answer:
I think the problem here is that there are two groups that will never meet in the middle - the one that’s here mostly for the community and the one that’s here mostly for the content.
If you’re here mostly because you enjoy transformative works, it’s obvious that you feel frustrated because all people seem to do is waiting and whining for content. I get that frustration, I really do.

It’s clear, though, that a big part of this fandom is mostly interested in content and there’s nothing anyone can do about it. Look, as someone who’s here for the content I’ll tell you something: I need to be happy about canon to engage with fanworks - that’s why I stopped reading Barney/Robin fanfics after the HIMYM Finale aired, that’s why I stopped reading Johnlock fanfics after the last season of Sherlock, that’s why I stopped following all the Himym/Sherlock blogs. If canon fucks me over, my interest in fanworks and the community drops and eventually disappears, no exception. And now, while I do still read phanfics, I find myself less excited and less invested because how can I be involved in transformative works about Dan and Phil if Dan and Phil themselves are not longer a source of joy? And someone might say “just leave, then” and they’d be right, but I can’t do that without having the absolute certainty that things will never come back to normal. Basically, I need Dan and Phil to give me their version of the Himym Finale/Sherlock S4 to do that. Until then, I’ll just stay here and complain because I care but I’m not happy and I need to let my thoughts out every once in a while.

So yeah I understand why people who love fandom spaces for the community are upset, but maybe they should try to understand that others simply don’t care about the community as much as they care about content.
